description: The adaptation of several story arcs from Nintendo’s Zelda video game series continues. In this volume, the Oracle of Seasons.
title: THE LEGEND OF ZELDA: LEGENDARY EDITION, VOL. 2
author: Akira Himekawa

description: Saitama sneaks into a combat tournament in order to hone his martial arts skills.
title: ONE-PUNCH MAN, VOL. 10
author: ONE and Yusuke Murata

description: A girl is chosen to be the apprentice — and the bride — of a powerful wizard. In this volume, Chise makes a friend.
title: THE ANCIENT MAGUS' BRIDE, VOL. 6
author: Kore Yamazaki

description: Ken Kaneki is attacked by a monster, but survives the encounter and becomes the first half-human, half-ghoul hybrid.
title: TOKYO GHOUL, VOL. 1
author: Sui Ishida

description: The beginning of the adaptation to Nintendo’s 1998 video game, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, is collected here.
title: THE LEGEND OF ZELDA: LEGENDARY EDITION, VOL. 1
author: Akira Himekawa

description: Mika is now a full–fledged vampire, just in time to join the battle at Nagoya Airport.
title: SERAPH OF THE END, VOL. 11
author: Takaya Kagami and Yamato Yamamoto

description: The Commission of Counter Ghoul’s investigations bring them dangerously close to discovering Kaneki’s secret.
title: TOKYO GHOUL, VOL. 10
author: Sui Ishida

description: This series, originally a web comic, features a hero named Saitama, who can defeat any monster or villain with just one punch.
title: ONE-PUNCH MAN, VOL. 1
author: ONE and Yusuke Murata

description: Light Yagami discovers a supernatural notebook that allows him to kill anyone he has seen by writing their name in it.
title: DEATH NOTE BLACK, VOL. 1
author: Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata

description: Can the Survey Corps execute Erwin’s final gambit, reclaiming Wall Maria and the secrets of humanity’s past?
title: ATTACK ON TITAN, VOL. 20
author: Hajime Isayama

description: In this book of tongue-in-cheek poetry, cats get help explaining their behavior.
title: I COULD PEE ON THIS
author: Francesco Marciuliano

description: Reflections on dogs — especially her Vizsla, Jasper — and politics, by the co-host of Fox News’s “The Five,” a former press secretary to President George W. Bush.
title: LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT JASPER ...
author: Dana Perino

description: The complex intelligence, emotional capacities, playfulness and spirit of the octopus, by a naturalist who counts several as friends.
title: THE SOUL OF AN OCTOPUS
author: Sy Montgomery

description: The story of Snowman the horse, the extraordinary jumper and national celebrity.
title: THE EIGHTY-DOLLAR CHAMPION
author: Elizabeth Letts

description: Research reveals that many birds rival primates and even humans in their complex forms of intelligence.
title: THE GENIUS OF BIRDS
author: Jennifer Ackerman

description: The evolutionary science, natural history and biology of house cats.
title: THE LION IN THE LIVING ROOM
author: Abigail Tucker

description: Dog adoption portraits and stories from New York City.
title: RESCUE ME
author: Richard Phibbs

description: A London busker befriends an injured cat, and the two become inseparable.
title: A STREET CAT NAMED BOB
author: James Bowen

description: A photographic tribute to dogs in motion celebrates lessons of living in the present, such as play, sleep, and scratching where it itches.
title: REALLY IMPORTANT STUFF MY DOG HAS TAUGHT ME
author: Cynthia L Copeland

description: A winner of the Nobel in economic science discusses how we make choices in business and personal lives and when we can and cannot trust our intuitions.
title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
author: Daniel Kahneman

description: A psychologist says passion and perseverance are the keys to success.
title: GRIT
author: Angela Duckworth

description: Cells, elevators, smartphones, nuclear reactors and more are demystified with simply annotated blueprints. From the author of "What If?"
title: THING EXPLAINER
author: Randall Munroe

description: The experience of the young Pakistani advocate for women’s education who was shot by the Taliban and later won the Nobel Peace Prize. Originally published in 2013.
title: I AM MALALA
author: Malala Yousafzai with Christina Lamb

description: A memoir that is a master class on the writer's craft.
title: ON WRITING
author: Stephen King

description: How decisions that impact our lives are made by algorithms instead of people.
title: WEAPONS OF MATH DESTRUCTION
author: Cathy O'Neil

description: A wide-ranging anthology selected by high school students.
title: BEST AMERICAN NONREQUIRED READING 2016
author: edited  Rachel Kushner

description: A mathematician shows how his discipline helps us think about problems of politics, medicine and commerce.
title: HOW NOT TO BE WRONG
author: Jordan Ellenberg

description: From the blog of the same name, 64 intriguing words from a dozen languages.
title: OTHER-WORDLY
author: Yee-Lum Mak

description: Essays by the star of “Gilmore Girls” (both the original and the mini-series) and “Parenthood.”
title: TALKING AS FAST AS I CAN
author: Lauren Graham

description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the comedian, now the host of “The Daily Show,” who was born into an illegal interracial relationship.
title: BORN A CRIME
author: Trevor Noah

description: An oral history of the show, based on extensive interviews with Jon Stewart and others.
title: THE DAILY SHOW (THE BOOK)
author: Chris Smith

description: Humorous personal essays by the comedian, actor and writer.
title: THE GIRL WITH THE LOWER BACK TATTOO
author: Amy Schumer

description: Autobiographical essays by the young actress.
title: SCRAPPY LITTLE NOBODY
author: Anna Kendrick

description: The further adventures of the TV producer ("Watch What Happens: Live" and the "Real Housewives" franchise) and personality.
title: SUPERFICIAL
author: Andy Cohen

description: A memoir based on Fisher’s one-woman autobiographical show. Originally published in 2008.
title: WISHFUL DRINKING
author: Carrie Fisher

description: From Woody Allen to Warren Zevon, an alphabetical list (with anecdotes) of the celebrities Griffin has met during her years in show business.
title: KATHY GRIFFIN'S CELEBRITY RUN-INS
author: Kathy Griffin

description: A children's book parody for tired parents. Originally published in 2011.
title: GO THE -- TO SLEEP
author: Adam Mansbach

description: Advice for parents-to-be. Originally published in 1984.
title: WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU'RE EXPECTING
author: Heidi Murkoff and Sharon Mazel

description: After her husband confesses to multiple infidelities, a woman who has overcome bulimia and alcoholism struggles to grow — and so does he.
title: LOVE WARRIOR
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

description: The sportscaster describes what it was like to forge his own career in the shadow of his beloved broadcasting father (who was also his best friend), Jack Buck.
title: LUCKY BASTARD
author: Joe Buck

description: Dad Darth tries to coax young Luke and Leia to sleep with a bedtime story.
title: GOODNIGHT DARTH VADER
author: Jeffrey Brown

description: A family guide to caring for people who have Alzheimer's disease, related dementias and memory loss.
title: THE 36-HOUR DAY
author: Nancy L Mace and Peter V Rabins

description: In this comic reimagining, the Dark Lord of the Sith is just like any other dad.
title: DARTH VADER AND SON
author: Jeffrey Brown

description: Overwhelmed by her father’s death, a British woman decides to raise a goshawk, a bird that is fierce and notoriously difficult to tame.
title: H IS FOR HAWK
author: Helen Macdonald

description: Essays about life with an over-involved parent, based on the Instagram account @CrazyJewishMom.
title: MOTHER, CAN YOU NOT?
author: Kate Siegel

description: Interviews with more than 70 teenagers shed light on their experience of sexuality.
title: GIRLS AND SEX
author: Peggy Orenstein

description: A richly documented ultimate explorer's guide to more than 700 hidden marvels, events and curiosities around the world.
title: ATLAS OBSCURA
author: Joshua Foer, Dylan Thuras and Ella Morton

description: More photographs, this time accompanied by interviews, from the creator of the blog and the book “Humans of New York.”
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK: STORIES
author: Brandon Stanton

description: An American expatriate travels around his adopted country, Britain.
title: THE ROAD TO LITTLE DRIBBLING
author: Bill Bryson

description: Four hundred color photos of New Yorkers, with brief commentsary. Originally published in 2013.
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK
author: Brandon Stanton

description: A memoir by the pilot who made an emergency landing on the Hudson River in 2009. Originally published as “Highest Duty” in 2009. The basis for the 2016 movie.
title: SULLY
author: Chesley B Sullenberger III with Jeffrey Zaslow

description: A photographic tour of 225 global destinations.
title: DESTINATIONS OF A LIFETIME
author: the staff of National Geographic

description: The creator of the New York Times dialect quiz provides a guide to how words are pronounced in different parts of the country.
title: SPEAKING AMERICAN
author: Josh Katz

description: An account of the life-changing 1,100-mile solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail in 1995. Originally published in 2012 and a 2014 movie.
title: WILD
author: Cheryl Strayed

description: The author was lost on a train in India at age 5, then adopted by a couple in Australia; he searched for and found his birth family as an adult. Originally published in 2014 as “A Long Way Home” and the basis for the 2016 movie.
title: LION
author: Saroo Brierley

description: Essays and 26 imaginative maps celebrate New York City.
title: NONSTOP METROPOLIS
author: Rebecca Solnit and Joshua Jelly-Schapiro

description: A memoir by a physician who received a diagnosis of Stage IV lung cancer at the age of 36.
title: WHEN BREATH BECOMES AIR
author: Paul Kalanithi

description: A blogger argues that we should stop striving to be positive at all times and instead become better at handling adversity.
title: THE SUBTLE ART OF NOT GIVING A F*CK
author: Mark Manson

description: Recipes for the Whole30 program of nonprocessed whole foods and no grains, dairy or sugar.
title: THE WHOLE30 COOKBOOK
author: Melissa Hartwig

description: The doctor and talk-show host promotes an eating plan that includes improving "gut health."
title: THE LOSE YOUR BELLY DIET
author: Travis Stork

description: An overview of the history and science of genetics by the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of “The Emperor of All Maladies.”
title: THE GENE
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee

description: Unconventional advice about 50 foods, the symptoms and conditions they can help relieve, and recipes.
title: MEDICAL MEDIUM LIFE-CHANGING FOODS
author: Anthony William

description: A 30-day plan for weight loss that includes recipes for meals and special treats.
title: GREEN SMOOTHIES FOR LIFE
author: J J Smith

description: A 14-day plan for cutting out all sugar and using protein and fiber to slow the absorption of carbohydrates.
title: THE ZERO SUGAR DIET
author: David Zinczenko with Stephen Perrine

description: Beverages of combined leafy greens and fruits are the basis for a weight loss and health plan.
title: 10-DAY GREEN SMOOTHIE CLEANSE
author: J J Smith

description: The surgeon and New Yorker writer considers how doctors fail patients at the end of life and how they can do better.
title: BEING MORTAL
author: Atul Gawande

description: Forty-eight garden designs, animals and paisley patterns, for every skill level.
title: STRESS RELIEF COLORING BOOK
author: the Adult Coloring Book Designs staff

description: Over 500 ideas for imaginative construction with Lego blocks.
title: THE LEGO IDEAS BOOK
author: Daniel Lipkowitz

description: Heraldry, creatures, wizards, props and scenes fill pages of widely varying complexity for all ages.
title: HARRY POTTER COLORING BOOK
author: various illustrators

description: A reference for Dungeons & Dragons role players includes rules for character creation and advancement, backgrounds and skills, equipment and spells.
title: PLAYER'S HANDBOOK
author: Wizards RPG Team

description: An adult coloring book with hidden creatures, a key and index.
title: SECRET GARDEN
author: Johanna Basford

description: An adult coloring book with hidden objects to detect, symbols to decipher and a surprise destination.
title: ENCHANTED FOREST
author: Johanna Basford

description: Secret shoals, reefs and shipwrecks with pirate treasure for adults to color.
title: LOST OCEAN
author: Johanna Basford

description: A horde of classic Dungeons & Dragons creatures.
title: MONSTER MANUAL
author: Wizards RPG Team

description: For dog lovers and colorists.
title: CREATIVE HAVEN DAZZLING DOGS COLORING BOOK
author: Marjorie Sarnat

description: Planets, galaxies, heroes and villains, and the Doctor, the TARDIS and the time vortex; 96 pages for adult coloring.
title: DOCTOR WHO COLORING BOOK
author: illlustrated  James Newman Gray, Lee Teng Chew and Jan Smith
